title: CU begins foundation training for new teachers
body: The inaugural ceremony of a five-day ‘Foundation Training Programme for Professional Development’ was held at the conference room of the CU vice-chancellor’s office at 9:00am on Sunday for the teachers appointed recently to various departments and institutes of Chittagong University. CU VC Professor Muhammad Yahya Akhtar was present as chief guest of the event organised by the Chittagong University Institutional Quality Assurance Cell. Pro-vice-chancellor (administration) Professor Md Kamal Uddin and CU registrar (acting) Professor Mohammad Saiful Islam were present as special guests. The inaugural ceremony was presided over by IQAC director Professor Mohammad Mosharraf Hossain and moderated by IQAC additional director Professor Shahadat Hossain. In the speech of the chief guest, the CU VC congratulated all the participating teachers and said, teaching is an art and it has to be achieved through practice. You have become teachers by passing a highly competitive examination because you are qualified. Now you have to prove it through your work. The trainers on the first day were CU pro-vice chancellor (academic) Professor Mohammad Shamim Uddin Khan, pro-VC Md Kamal Uddin, registrar Saiful Islam and CU controller of examinations Professor Momtaz Uddin Ahmed. The training will be held from 9:30am to 4:30pm every day till December 11. A total of 28 teachers from different departments and institutes participated in the training.
